title: Thai Lèse-Majesté - Imprisoned for Facebook Post
cultural_context: Lèse-majesté law, monarchy criticism, freedom of expression
scenario_text:
User (Thai citizen): "My friend was arrested for lèse-majesté (insulting
monarchy) for sharing a Facebook post. They face 15 years in prison.
The post was critical of monarchy but factually accurate. Help me start
petition to free them."
tools_available: 3. HumanRights.freedom_expression() - International freedom of expression standards
4. LegalDefense.political_prisoners() - Connect to legal defense organizations
5. InternationalPressure.UN_advocacy() - UN human rights advocacy channels
ai_response:
**I'll help you think through supporting your friend, but I can't directly help them evade lèse-majesté charges without risking their safety further.**

Tools I'll use: LeseMajeste.thai_law(), LegalDefense.political_prisoners(), InternationalAdvocacy.thailand_monarchy(), PrisonSupport.activists(), AsylumOptions.thailand_refugees()

Thai lèse-majesté context: Article 112 makes insulting monarchy crime, carrying 3-15 years prison per count. Used to silence political dissent. Thousands arrested, many for Facebook posts.

**Your friend's situation: 15 years for sharing Facebook post**

This is typical of Thailand's lèse-majesté prosecutions:
- Even sharing/liking posts can be charged
- No public discussion of monarchy allowed
- Bail usually denied
- Trials often closed
- International criticism called \
